moves.5... c6: If I thought he knew what he was doing, I'd be worried.
moves.6. Nc3 Bf6 7. e5: Setting up more messing with the g pawn.
moves.11... d5 12. Nef6+: And this is where it becomes hilarious to me. Messing with him truly starts.
moves.12... Ke7 13. Qh5: Turned the rook down for comedy later.
moves.14... Kd6 15. Rad1: Trying to bait him into taking the bishop, then I take the pawn, pinning the king to the queen with the rook.
moves.15... Qb6: Idiocy or genius. Hard to tell.
moves.16. Be3 Rg6: Oh no, wait, it was idiocy.
moves.18. Ng5: More fun to come if he takes the bishop.
moves.19. Nxf7+ Kc5: I asked him if he wanted me to finish it or to mess some more. He picked mess.
moves.20... Nxc4 21. dxc4: I'm expecting the king to take, resulting in me forking his bishop for no gain.
moves.21... dxc4: And then that happened. Meh. Changes not much.
moves.22. Nd6 Bd7: There are times I love this game.
moves.23... Kb5 24. Rxd7 a4 25. Rxb7+ Ka5: At this point it's mate in about three moves, but he wanted me to mess with him so mess I shall.
moves.26. Qf7: Pawn pinning! That people, is how you mess. Take all the other guys pieces by pinning pawns with your queen lol.
moves.26... Rh8 27. Qxe6: And now I'm forking pawns. Comedy. Gotta be careful not to mate or stalemate here.
moves.27... Rh4 28. Qxc6 Rxe4: I think he knows I want all his pieces before winning, and wants me to mate him before I stalemate by being greedy. Or maybe he's just suiciding.
